results.title: Workout
results.desc:
Lists are an efficient tool for quick and easy access to your workout routines. 

The initial setup of your workout lists is a one-time effort. Once established, these lists serve as a well-organized library of routines that you can follow consistently. 

You can utilize the list description area to note important details such as progression instructions or specific goals for each workout, as shown in the example below.

results.title: Muscle Group
results.desc:
Lists offer a dynamic way to organize your workouts by muscle group, allowing you to monitor your progress for each specific muscle area. 

You can create lists with names like 'Lower Body' for a general muscle group focus, or more specific ones like 'Biceps' for targeted muscle training. 

By categorizing workouts this way, you can easily review which muscle groups are being worked on consistently and which ones might need more attention. 

A single exercise can often target multiple muscle groups. Hence, you can assign the same exercise to several lists. For example, squats can be placed in both 'Lower Body' and 'Glutes' lists.

results.title: Program
results.desc:
Lists are a valuable tool for tracking and accessing your workout routine effortlessly. This is particularly effective for structured programs like the Push Pull Legs (PPL) regimen. 

First, Organize program into lists for each workout day. This helps in maintaining a clear and consistent workout schedule. 

Then, Detail the exercises for each day in separate lists. 

The notes section becomes an essential part of this setup. You can elaborate on exercise techniques, progression plans, and personal performance notes.

results.title: Day of Week
results.desc:
Lists can be organized by day of the week. 

The examples below illustrate a weekly list structure. You can try out a similar list set up if you follow a program with designated days for each workout, or if you usually like working out on a specific day. 

You could also use list notes to specify this information as shown below. 

Do not include dates like 'May 5 Workout' in your list names. Setgraph automatically logs the date for every set you record.

results.title: Intensity
results.desc:
Categorizing your routines by intensity levels is a smart way to personalize your fitness plan. This method ensures that you can align your workouts with your current energy levels, available time, and fitness goals. 

Here's how to implement this categorization effectively: 

First, Organize your workouts into lists labeled as 'Low Intensity,' 'Moderate Intensity,' and 'High Intensity.' 

Then, You can adjust the contents of each list based on your personal fitness level and preferences, adding or modifying workouts as you progress.

results.title: Duration
results.desc:
Organizing your workouts based on duration is a practical approach that ensures you can stay active, no matter how busy your schedule is. 

By creating lists for different time lengths, you can easily select a workout that fits into your available time slot, ensuring you're always ready for any occasion. 

The 30 minute example below showcases how you can use descriptions to note your plan at a list level.

results.title: Location
results.desc:
For those who find themselves working out in various locations, setting up lists for each specific location can greatly enhance the convenience of your routine. 

This method allows for the creation of tailored workouts that suit the environment and available resources of each location. 

You can organize your workouts into lists named after each location you frequently exercise in. This could include 'Home Workouts,' 'Gym Routines,' 'Outdoor Sessions,' etc.

results.title: Favourites
results.desc:
While you might have specific lists for your different workouts such as 'Pull' or 'Legs', having a separate list for your favorites allows you to bring together a variety of exercises you prefer from different routines. 

It's a simple way to keep an eye on the exercises that matter most to you, ensuring easy access and individual stat tracking for your most-liked exercises.

results.title: Equipment
results.desc:
Organizing your workouts by equipment type can streamline your fitness routine. Here's how you can implement this method: 

First, Set up lists such as 'Machine Exercises,' 

'Barbells,' 'Free Weights,' and 'Bodyweight.' This categorization helps you quickly identify the right workout according to the equipment available. 

Then, Tailor each list with exercises that fit your fitness level and goals, ensuring a personalized workout experience. 

By organizing your workouts by the type of equipment, you gain the flexibility to adapt your routine to any setting. This is especially useful when your equipment options change, such as when traveling or visiting a different gym.

results.title: Goal
results.desc:
Different lists can be created to focus on specific goals. For example, as seen in the PHUL program, one list can target hypertrophy, while another can be dedicated to increasing strength and power. 

This approach allows for accurate tracking of progression for each distinct goal.
